title: Labelling
fullText:
The patient area shall be inspected to ensure the labelling is intact and specified as follows:
(a)	For RCDs used as LPDs, labelling that identifies RCD number and circuit numbers.
(b)	For LIMs, labelling that identifies LIM number and circuit numbers.
(c)	For overload monitors, labelling of alarm current setting.
(d)	For socket-outlets protected by LPDs, other than those identified 'CLEANING PURPOSES ONLY', labelling to indicate 'RCD PROTECTED' or 'ISOLATION TRANSFORMER PROTECTED' and label indicating from which RCD or LIM the socket-outlet is protected 'From RCDX number/From LIM X'.
(e)	For socket-outlets intended for cleaning purposes, labelling to indicate 'CLEANING PURPOSES ONLY'.
The cardiac-protected electrical area sign(s) shall have all superseded inspection labels and alteration and addition labels (excluding commissioning labels) removed and be re-labelled to indicate the following:
(i)	The date at which the current inspection and test was completed.
(ii)	The identity of the authorized person.
(iii)	The date at which the next inspection and test is due.
(iv)	The report number of the latest test.
